abstract: MySpace will keep the start-up operating as a separate company, at least for now, but the deal raises questions about iLike’s future relationship with Facebook, MySpace’s archrival.
snippet: MySpace will keep the start-up operating as a separate company, at least for now, but the deal raises questions about iLike’s future relationship with Facebook, MySpace’s archrival.
lead_paragraph: Confirming rumors circulating around the Web this week, MySpace said today that it would acquire iLike, a popular music application for social networks that lets users share playlists and make song recommendations.

headline.main: MySpace Buys iLike Music Sharing Service
